functionDecorators.name: borrow
functionDecorators.description: Allows users to borrow a specific `amount` of the reserve underlying asset, provided that the borrower already deposited enough collateral, or he was given enough allowance by a credit delegator on the corresponding debt token (StableDebtToken or VariableDebtToken) - E.g. User borrows 100 USDC passing as `onBehalfOf` his own address, receiving the 100 USDC in his wallet and 100 stable/variable debt tokens, depending on the `interestRateMode`.

parameterDecorators.name: asset
parameterDecorators.description: The address of the underlying asset to borrow.

parameterDecorators.name: amount
parameterDecorators.description: The amount to be borrowed.

parameterDecorators.name: interestRateMode
parameterDecorators.description: The interest rate mode at which the user wants to borrow: 1 for Stable, 2 for Variable.

parameterDecorators.name: referralCode
parameterDecorators.description: Code used to register the integrator originating the operation, for potential rewards. 0 if the action is executed directly by the user, without any middle-man.

parameterDecorators.name: onBehalfOf
parameterDecorators.description: Address of the user who will receive the debt. Should be the address of the borrower itself calling the function if he wants to borrow against his own collateral, or the address of the credit delegator if he has been given credit delegation allowance*.

functionDecorators.name: deposit
functionDecorators.description: Deposits an `amount` of underlying asset into the reserve, receiving in return overlying aTokens. - E.g. User deposits 100 USDC and gets in return 100 aUSDC.

parameterDecorators.name: asset
parameterDecorators.description: The address of the underlying asset to deposit.

parameterDecorators.name: amount
parameterDecorators.description: The amount to be deposited.

parameterDecorators.name: onBehalfOf
parameterDecorators.description: The address that will receive the aTokens, same as msg.sender if the user wants to receive them on his own wallet, or a different address if the beneficiary of aTokens is a different wallet.

parameterDecorators.name: referralCode
parameterDecorators.description: Code used to register the integrator originating the operation, for potential rewards. 0 if the action is executed directly by the user, without any middle-man*.

functionDecorators.name: finalizeTransfer
functionDecorators.description: Validates and finalizes an aToken transfer - Only callable by the overlying aToken of the `asset`.

parameterDecorators.name: asset
parameterDecorators.description: The address of the underlying asset of the aToken.

parameterDecorators.name: from
parameterDecorators.description: The user from which the aTokens are transferred.

parameterDecorators.name: to
parameterDecorators.description: The user receiving the aTokens.

parameterDecorators.name: amount
parameterDecorators.description: The amount being transferred/withdrawn.

parameterDecorators.name: balanceFromBefore
parameterDecorators.description: The aToken balance of the `from` user before the transfer.

parameterDecorators.name: balanceToBefore
parameterDecorators.description: The aToken balance of the `to` user before the transfer.

functionDecorators.name: flashLoan
functionDecorators.description: Allows smartcontracts to access the liquidity of the pool within one transaction, as long as the amount taken plus a fee is returned. IMPORTANT There are security concerns for developers of flashloan receiver contracts that must be kept into consideration. For further details please visit https://developers.aave.com.

parameterDecorators.name: receiverAddress
parameterDecorators.description: The address of the contract receiving the funds, implementing the IFlashLoanReceiver interface.

parameterDecorators.name: assets
parameterDecorators.description: The addresses of the assets being flash-borrowed.

parameterDecorators.name: amounts
parameterDecorators.description: The amounts amounts being flash-borrowed.

parameterDecorators.name: modes
parameterDecorators.description: Types of the debt to open if the flash loan is not returned: 0 -> Don't open any debt, just revert if funds can't be transferred from the receiver 1 -> Open debt at stable rate for the value of the amount flash-borrowed to the `onBehalfOf` address 2 -> Open debt at variable rate for the value of the amount flash-borrowed to the `onBehalfOf` address.

parameterDecorators.name: onBehalfOf
parameterDecorators.description: The address that will receive the debt in the case of using on `modes` 1 or 2.

parameterDecorators.name: params
parameterDecorators.description: Variadic packed params to pass to the receiver as extra information.

parameterDecorators.name: referralCode
parameterDecorators.description: Code used to register the integrator originating the operation, for potential rewards. 0 if the action is executed directly by the user, without any middle-man*.

functionDecorators.name: getAddressesProvider
functionDecorators.description: Returns the cached LendingPoolAddressesProvider connected to this contract*.

functionDecorators.name: getConfiguration
functionDecorators.description: Returns the configuration of the reserve.

parameterDecorators.name: asset
parameterDecorators.description: The address of the underlying asset of the reserve.

functionDecorators.name: getReserveData
functionDecorators.description: Returns the state and configuration of the reserve.

parameterDecorators.name: asset
parameterDecorators.description: The address of the underlying asset of the reserve.

functionDecorators.name: getReserveNormalizedIncome
functionDecorators.description: Returns the normalized income per unit of asset.

parameterDecorators.name: asset
parameterDecorators.description: The address of the underlying asset of the reserve.

functionDecorators.name: getReserveNormalizedVariableDebt
functionDecorators.description: Returns the normalized variable debt per unit of asset.

parameterDecorators.name: asset
parameterDecorators.description: The address of the underlying asset of the reserve.

functionDecorators.name: getReservesList
functionDecorators.description: Returns the list of the initialized reserves*.

functionDecorators.name: getUserAccountData
functionDecorators.description: Returns the user account data across all the reserves.

parameterDecorators.name: user
parameterDecorators.description: The address of the user.

returnDecorators.name: totalCollateralETH
returnDecorators.description: the total collateral in ETH of the user.

returnDecorators.name: totalDebtETH
returnDecorators.description: the total debt in ETH of the user.

returnDecorators.name: availableBorrowsETH
returnDecorators.description: the borrowing power left of the user.

returnDecorators.name: currentLiquidationThreshold
returnDecorators.description: the liquidation threshold of the user.

returnDecorators.name: ltv
returnDecorators.description: the loan to value of the user.

returnDecorators.name: healthFactor
returnDecorators.description: the current health factor of the user*.

functionDecorators.name: getUserConfiguration
functionDecorators.description: Returns the configuration of the user across all the reserves.

parameterDecorators.name: user
parameterDecorators.description: The user address.

functionDecorators.name: initReserve
functionDecorators.description: Initializes a reserve, activating it, assigning an aToken and debt tokens and an interest rate strategy - Only callable by the LendingPoolConfigurator contract.

parameterDecorators.name: asset
parameterDecorators.description: The address of the underlying asset of the reserve.

parameterDecorators.name: aTokenAddress
parameterDecorators.description: The address of the VariableDebtToken that will be assigned to the reserve.

parameterDecorators.name: stableDebtAddress
parameterDecorators.description: The address of the StableDebtToken that will be assigned to the reserve.

parameterDecorators.name: interestRateStrategyAddress
parameterDecorators.description: The address of the interest rate strategy contract*.

functionDecorators.name: initialize
functionDecorators.description: Function is invoked by the proxy contract when the LendingPool contract is added to the LendingPoolAddressesProvider of the market. - Caching the address of the LendingPoolAddressesProvider in order to reduce gas consumption on subsequent operations.

parameterDecorators.name: provider
parameterDecorators.description: The address of the LendingPoolAddressesProvider*.

functionDecorators.name: liquidationCall
functionDecorators.description: Function to liquidate a non-healthy position collateral-wise, with Health Factor below 1 - The caller (liquidator) covers `debtToCover` amount of debt of the user getting liquidated, and receives a proportionally amount of the `collateralAsset` plus a bonus to cover market risk.

parameterDecorators.name: collateralAsset
parameterDecorators.description: The address of the underlying asset used as collateral, to receive as result of the liquidation.

parameterDecorators.name: debtAsset
parameterDecorators.description: The address of the underlying borrowed asset to be repaid with the liquidation.

parameterDecorators.name: user
parameterDecorators.description: The address of the borrower getting liquidated.

parameterDecorators.name: debtToCover
parameterDecorators.description: The debt amount of borrowed `asset` the liquidator wants to cover.

parameterDecorators.name: receiveAToken
parameterDecorators.description: `true` if the liquidators wants to receive the collateral aTokens, `false` if he wants to receive the underlying collateral asset directly*.

functionDecorators.name: paused
functionDecorators.description: Returns if the LendingPool is paused.

functionDecorators.name: rebalanceStableBorrowRate
functionDecorators.description: Rebalances the stable interest rate of a user to the current stable rate defined on the reserve. - Users can be rebalanced if the following conditions are satisfied: 1. Usage ratio is above 95% 2. the current deposit APY is below REBALANCE_UP_THRESHOLD * maxVariableBorrowRate, which means that too much has been borrowed at a stable rate and depositors are not earning enough.

parameterDecorators.name: asset
parameterDecorators.description: The address of the underlying asset borrowed.

parameterDecorators.name: user
parameterDecorators.description: The address of the user to be rebalanced*.

functionDecorators.name: repay
functionDecorators.description: Repays a borrowed `amount` on a specific reserve, burning the equivalent debt tokens owned - E.g. User repays 100 USDC, burning 100 variable/stable debt tokens of the `onBehalfOf` address.

parameterDecorators.name: asset
parameterDecorators.description: The address of the borrowed underlying asset previously borrowed.

parameterDecorators.name: amount
parameterDecorators.description: The amount to repay - Send the value type(uint256).max in order to repay the whole debt for `asset` on the specific `debtMode`.

parameterDecorators.name: rateMode
parameterDecorators.description: The interest rate mode at of the debt the user wants to repay: 1 for Stable, 2 for Variable.

parameterDecorators.name: onBehalfOf
parameterDecorators.description: Address of the user who will get his debt reduced/removed. Should be the address of the user calling the function if he wants to reduce/remove his own debt, or the address of any other other borrower whose debt should be removed.

functionDecorators.name: setConfiguration
functionDecorators.description: Sets the configuration bitmap of the reserve as a whole - Only callable by the LendingPoolConfigurator contract.

parameterDecorators.name: asset
parameterDecorators.description: The address of the underlying asset of the reserve.

parameterDecorators.name: configuration
parameterDecorators.description: The new configuration bitmap*.

functionDecorators.name: setPause
functionDecorators.description: Set the _pause state of a reserve - Only callable by the LendingPoolConfigurator contract.

parameterDecorators.name: val
parameterDecorators.description: `true` to pause the reserve, `false` to un-pause it.

functionDecorators.name: setReserveInterestRateStrategyAddress
functionDecorators.description: Updates the address of the interest rate strategy contract - Only callable by the LendingPoolConfigurator contract.

parameterDecorators.name: asset
parameterDecorators.description: The address of the underlying asset of the reserve.

parameterDecorators.name: rateStrategyAddress
parameterDecorators.description: The address of the interest rate strategy contract*.

functionDecorators.name: setUserUseReserveAsCollateral
functionDecorators.description: Allows depositors to enable/disable a specific deposited asset as collateral.

parameterDecorators.name: asset
parameterDecorators.description: The address of the underlying asset deposited.

parameterDecorators.name: useAsCollateral
parameterDecorators.description: `true` if the user wants to use the deposit as collateral, `false` otherwise*.

functionDecorators.name: swapBorrowRateMode
functionDecorators.description: Allows a borrower to swap his debt between stable and variable mode, or viceversa.

parameterDecorators.name: asset
parameterDecorators.description: The address of the underlying asset borrowed.

parameterDecorators.name: rateMode
parameterDecorators.description: The rate mode that the user wants to swap to*.

functionDecorators.name: withdraw
functionDecorators.description: Withdraws an `amount` of underlying asset from the reserve, burning the equivalent aTokens owned E.g. User has 100 aUSDC, calls withdraw() and receives 100 USDC, burning the 100 aUSDC.

parameterDecorators.name: asset
parameterDecorators.description: The address of the underlying asset to withdraw.

parameterDecorators.name: amount
parameterDecorators.description: The underlying amount to be withdrawn - Send the value type(uint256).max in order to withdraw the whole aToken balance.

parameterDecorators.name: to
parameterDecorators.description: Address that will receive the underlying, same as msg.sender if the user wants to receive it on his own wallet, or a different address if the beneficiary is a different wallet.
